Trust is not given\u2014it must be designed into AI systems from the outset. This paper discusses the challenges of AI audits , including fairness and transparency, and emphasizes the importance of auditors' competencies. Based on interviews with 23 AI professionals, it proposes an AI auditability framework and required competencies. How can AI improve audit quality research? The findings of the study also have implications for the accounting information system domain. Are AI systems auditable? AI audits are expected to ensure that AI systems function lawfully, robustly, and follow ethical standards (e.g., fairness). While the auditability for financial audits and information system audits has been well addressed in the literature, auditability of AI systems has not been sufficiently addressed . Do Ai audits need auditability measures? This study systematically summarizes the current academic work and government and industrial regulations on AI audits as well as identifies auditability measures appropriate for each audit area and each specific process to be audited. The parties and persons responsible for implementing each set of auditability measures are also specified. How many research articles have been reviewed about AI audits & auditability?
